key_responsibilities: serving as an official representative for the Member throughout communities in the District
acting as liaison to federal, district, and local government agencies and elected officials
establishing and maintaining effective relationships with community members and organizations
monitoring local issues of importance and keeping the District Director updated
providing logistical support and staffing the Member at district meetings and events
assessing local and casework-related issues for problems requiring possible legislative action; making recommendations to the District Director and Chief of Staff
responding to casework correspondence and inquiries from constituents
providing casework assistance to constituents in a timely and efficient manner; proactively following up on all open cases until a resolution is reached
requirements: ability to work non-traditional hours, including nights and weekends
excellent written and interpersonal communication skills
ability to work with staff at all levels, work well under pressure and be detail-oriented
possess an understanding of the federal legislative process
ability to quickly learn about key issues and events in the district for which the Member is involved
a valid California driver’s license with the ability to travel as needed

providing direct support to constituents

conducting legal and factual research
writing memoranda, statements, questions and speeches
ensuring subcommittee priorities are reflected in appropriations and authorization bills
leading oversight initiatives
requirements: expertise in the areas described above
the ability to work closely with a team and remain entrepreneurial
possess excellent written and oral communication skills
